H0.text: Larger feet are an adaptation that helps a bird fly.

H1.text: Bigger eyes help a bird fly.

H2.text: Longer beaks help a bird fly.

H3.text: Hollow bones are an adaptation that helps a bird fly.

A4.text: Birds have many bones that are hollow (pneumatized) with criss-crossing struts or trusses for structural strength.

A5.text: The development of a beak has led to evolution of a specially adapted digestive system.
